SEARCH
Package Domain

Class Keyboard

java.lang.Object
Domain.Keyboard
public class Keyboard extends Object
The Keyboard class represents a keyboard, with its unique key and a distribution of characters. It provides methods to initialize the keyboard, modify character positions, and retrieve key and distribution information.

    • Keyboard

      public Keyboard(String key, int[][] characterPositions, char[] characters)
      Constructor for the Keyboard class.
      Parameters:
      key - The unique key associated with the keyboard.
      characterPositions - The positions of characters on the keyboard.
      characters - The characters corresponding to the positions on the keyboard.

    • Keyboard

      Constructor for the Keyboard class.
      Parameters:
      key - The unique key associated with the keyboard.
      distribution - The character distribution on the keys of the keyboard.

  • Method Details

    • modify

      public int modify(int i1, int j1, int i2, int j2)
      Exchanges the positions of 2 characters on the keyboard.
      Parameters:
      i1 - The row index of the first position.
      j1 - The column index of the first position.
      i2 - The row index of the second position.
      j2 - The column index of the second position.
      Returns:
      0 if the modification is successful, -1 if the first position is incorrect, -2 if the second position is incorrect.

    • getKey

      public String getKey()
      Gets the key associated with the keyboard.
      Returns:
      The key of the keyboard.

    • setKey

      public void setKey(String key)
      Sets the key associated with the keyboard.
      Parameters:
      key - The new key for the keyboard.

    • getDistribution

      public char[][] getDistribution()
      Gets the two-dimensional array representing the distribution of characters on the keyboard.
      Returns:
      The distribution of characters on the keyboard.
